title.narrative: 4.2. ALTERNATIVE BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Out of school children realise their right to education through innovative and diverse delivery of basic education, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, 850,000 children and young people (from 5 to 24 years old) have access to quality education opportunities

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF INTERIOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND RECONCILIATION SOUTHWEST STATE OF SOMALIA

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.

Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Out of school children realise their right to education through innovative and diverse delivery of basic education

description.narrative: UNICEF supported interventions enabled 52,334 Children (46% girls) access Alternative Basic Education (ABE) centers across Somalia, with the highest number of new enrolments occurring in central and southern regions (CSR) and Somaliland due to the acceleration of enrolment of new students into ABE in Central South Zone | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of additional children (6-14 years) enrolled in alternative education schools

actual.value: 2016:An additional 15,291 children gained access to ABE CSZ: 7,643 (46% f) NEZ: 4,416 (50% f) NWZ: 3,232 (52% f)

title.narrative: Number of additional temporary classrooms provided in alternative basic education schools

actual.value: 2016:An additional 407 Temporary Learning Spaces were established: NEZ: 34 CSZ: 180 NWZ: 193

title.narrative: Model for using radio/MP3 players/e-tablets and e-readers in Upper Primary Schools available and in use

target.value: 2017:NWZ, At least 1 model developed and in use; NEZ, At least 1 other model developed and in use; CSZ, At least 1 other model developed and in use

actual.value: 2016:NEZ: 0 CSZ: One model under development/revision but not yet used in schools. NWZ: 0
